availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James D. Landrum (Trigg and Graves County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Trigg and Graves County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine E.S. Robbins Landrum in Trigg County, Kentucky, on August 11, 1850. Father of William Landrum, Thomas Landrum, Mary Landrum, Louisa Landrum, and John Landrum. Physician in Trigg County in 1850. Physician in Graves County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, City/District, p. X.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, City/District, p. X.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, City/District, p. X A/B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, City/District, p. XA/B.
Journal of the Regular Session of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (1864), December 7, 1863 - February 22, 1864 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1864), 4.
Journal of the Adjourned Session of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (1865), January 4, 1865 - June 5, 1865 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1865), 4.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 134.
